short_summary: Energy storage inverter for  locations in Varennes, Qu",bec, Canada
duration_in_months: You do not specify how long the process is expected to last
full_summary:
### Notice for Request for Proposal (RFP)
### Request For Proposal (RFP) Details

* **Tender Reference Number**: WS4274205939-Doc4274231094
* **Solicitation Number**: WS4274205939-Doc4274231094
* **Publication Date**: 26 October 2023
* **Tender Closing Date**: 28 November 2023, 14:00 (Eastern Standard Time)
* **Trade Agreements**: This contract will be entered under the Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA) and the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* **Procurement Method:** Competitive - Open bidding
* **Procurement Category:** Goods - General (GD)
* **Request For Proposal Description**: The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) has issued a request for proposal (RFP) for the acquisition of an energy storage inverter for Natural Resources Canada (NRCan). The selected goods will be delivered in Varennes, Québec, Canada.
* **End User Entity:** The end user of the goods will be Natural Resources Canada (NRCan).
* **Contracting Entity:** The contracting entity for this contract will be the Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) 11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage, Gatineau, QC, Canada K1A 0S5
* **Point of Contact:** For more information about the RFP, please contact Annie Blanchet, Workplace Conflict Prevention Team at annie.blanchet@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

### Attachment and Notice

[There is no attachment]
The notice for this RFP is available at: https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/17837527?extsite=-refID-

### Notes for Submission
A request for proposal (RFP) implies a competitive process where the best proposal is selected. Please carefully review the RFP document and follow the submission guidelines provided.

The submission guidelines and the terms of reference of the RFP can be found in Annex A. 

**Disclaimer:** This notice alone is not a formal solicitation of proposals by any agency of the government. The solicitation is issued and will be posted exclusively at the website indicated above. Cluses shall be accepted by mail, courier, or by email. All proposals must be submitted in a timely manner to a case manager.
